meanings.definition: A film bearing a miniature photographic copy of printed or other graphic matter, usually of a document, newspaper or book.
meanings.sent1: The library keeps important documents on microfilm for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: I found an old newspaper on microfilm at the archives.
meanings.sent3: When the tiny aliens visited, they were amazed by our use of microfilm.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a microfilm, capturing every detail with precision.
meanings.sent5: The microfilm glowed under the light, revealing its hidden contents.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to microfilm all the historical records.
meanings.sent2: They will microfilm the documents to ensure they are preserved.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally microfilmed my thumb instead of the document!
meanings.sent4: His mind could microfilm every detail of the scene in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The artist's eyes seemed to microfilm the beauty of the landscape.
